alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:02PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong northerly winds will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne and western Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 745 PM MDT... At 659 PM MDT, strong northerly winds emanating from thunderstorms in Lincoln and Washington counties were progressing southward through western Kit Carson county, along a line extending from 11 miles north of Vona to near Seibert to 9 miles southwest of Flagler. Movement was south to southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and locally reduced visibilities associated with blowing dust. SOURCE...An observation site in Flagler, Colorado reported a 55 mph wind gust at 639 PM MDT. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions. This includes Interstate 70 from Flagler east to Bethune. Locations impacted include... Stratton. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 390 and 424. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
